üöÄ
–ü–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω—ñ –ø—É—Å–∫–∏ –ö–ê–ë –Ω–∞ –î–æ–Ω–µ—á—á–∏–Ω—É.

On the southern flank of Siversk, Russian forces intensified their assault operations, making significant progress towards the southern outskirts of Siversk.
In the south, Russian forces advanced west from Vyimka and captured positions in three different treelines. They also advanced from the south, mostly levelling the frontline between Vymika and Pereizne and establishing full control over the rest of the tactical heights here.
To the north, Russian forces advanced further up the railway line, capturing the last main Ukrainian trenches and strongpoints before Siversk. They also captured the large trench fortification east of the reservoir and captured positions in the forest to the north.
+ ~3.00 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

On the eastern flank of Lyman and on the northern flank of Siversk, Russian forces continued their offensive operations and have made significant progress in the area of the main Ukrainian logistical route for the region. 
In the northwest, Russian forces continued pushing through the forests to the Masliakivka District of Lyman. They captured additional positions here, and advanced south of the district to the main part of Lyman. They also secured the rest of the forests east of the Masliakivka District, fully pushing the Ukrainians back to the treelines to the northwest.
To the south, Russian forces continued advancing south from the railway line. After cutting the Lyman - Siversk Highway, the Russians were able to reach the two reservoirs from the north and establish control over the forests there. They also bypassed the reservoirs from the east, cutting the highway at a new point. Meanwhile, fighting continues for the highway intersection on the southeastern approaches to Lyman.
To the southeast, Russian forces continued their push through Yampil and have captured additional positions in the southwestern part of the village. Ukrainian forces have - for the most part - withdrawn from the settlement, but the southwestern-most houses remain in the grey zone.
To the east, Russian forces advanced from the north and east, clearing the last parts of the village of Dronivka, bringing it under their control. The Ukrainians withdrew to the treelines further south.
+ ~10.63 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

On the northeastern flank of Lyman, Russian forces continued their offensive operations and have made substantial progress towards the Donetsk - Kharkiv Regional Border.
In the southwest, Russian forces advanced further from their foothold in the National Park towards the village of Yarova. They advanced down the road to the destroyed railway bridges, and reached the crossroads where fighting is now ongoing. They also cleared additional positions on the flanks to the east and west, linking up with assault groups in the eastern part of the National Park. 
To the northeast, Russian forces resumed their assault operations west of Serednje. They advanced further along the treeline on the southern edge of the gulley and entered the adjacent orchards. Other forces pushed northeast up the treelines, forcing the remaining Ukrainian soldiers to withdraw from the salient, which was subsequently brought under Russian control. 
+ ~13.48 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russia's elite drone unit "Rubicon" is heavily striking Ukrainian soldiers attempting to escape the Pokrovsk-Myrnograd pocket. 
This screenshot shows strikes from a single one of their compilations today.

In the Lyman direction, Russian forces continued to approach Lyman from the east and have made additional progress in the forests there.
Russian forces advanced further west through the forests in the Pynkiv Yar Gulley. They captured new trenches here and are approaching the western edge of the gulley along with the next set of tactical heights. Additionally, they advanced along the treeline on the heights to the north and captured new positions in the adjacent forested areas.
+ ~1.56 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Kupyansk direction, Russian forces were able to break through Ukrainian positions in the southern part of the city and have begun advancing further south down the western bank of the Oskil River.
Russian forces completed the capture of the Yuvileynyi high-rise microdistrict, as well as the low-rise residential areas to the east and west, and advanced to the southernmost streets of Kupyansk. They were able to capture these streets and quickly broke through to the south, establishing control over forested areas, while advancing southwest into the forests in the direction of Blahodativka. 
Some assault groups have managed to push further, establishing positions in and around Sadove and reaching the northern approaches to Osynovo. However, positions here are mixed, with the Ukrainians and Russians each sitting behind each other. 
Additionally, some Russian soldiers were able to cross the Oskil River from western Kupyansk again and entered the residential areas there. Currently it is unclear if any consolidation has taken place. 
+ ~2.96 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

The Ukrainian SBU head claims that Ukrainian long-range UAVs destroyed a Russian Oreshnik IRBM complex at the Kapustin Yar Test Site, Astrakhan Oblast.
There was a UAV threat in place for Astrakhan Oblast yesterday.
EDIT: The claim was referring to a strike from 2023, not recent

In the Khotin direction, both Ukrainian and Russian forces are advancing, each attempting to retake previously lost positions. 
Ukrainian forces continued their attacks on the village of Kostyantynivka, and after striking it with glide-bombs and artillery, entered it from the southwest and south. They were able to gain a foothold and began pushing towards the northern houses and the international border. Heavy, costly fighting is ongoing. 
Meanwhile, Russian forces continued attacking in the Oleksiivka area. They were able to recapture the agricultural buildings on the western outskirts and pushed the Ukrainians out of the centre of the village. From there the Russians are attempting to re-establish control over the southern part of Oleksiivka where fighting is still ongoing.
+ ~5.03 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
+ ~2.27 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

2 Russian MiG-31Ks are redeploying from Savasleika Airbase, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, to Akhtubinsk Airbase, Astrakhan Oblast. They will each be equipped with a Kinzhal aeroballistic missile.   Additionally, yesterday, 6 Tu-95MS strategic bombers redeployed‚Ä¶

Correction: 7 Tu-95MS, not 6, were redeployed from Engels-2 Airbase to Ukrainka Airbase.
Additionally, 1 of the 4 Tu-160s redeployed to Ukrainka. The statuses of the other 3 is currently unknown.

New Ukrainian defenses this week.
Yellow = ditches
Blue = dragon's teeth
Gray = barbed wire
Red = new

A Ukrainian UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter dropped off a group of Ukrainian special forces behind Russian lines on the outskirts of Pokrovsk. 
It is claimed that they are trying to regain control over the logistical routes into the city here.

A Ukrainian UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter dropped off a group of Ukrainian special forces behind Russian lines on the outskirts of Pokrovsk. 
It is claimed that they are trying to regain control over the logistical routes into the city here.

A Ukrainian UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter dropped off a group of Ukrainian special forces behind Russian lines on the outskirts of Pokrovsk.   It is claimed that they are trying to regain control over the logistical routes into the city here.
Most/all of the GUR special forces were killed or wounded by Russian FPV drones as they attempted to entrench behind Russian lines.
Most/all of the GUR special forces were killed or wounded by Russian FPV drones as they attempted to entrench behind Russian lines.
The video is real btw. I geolocated it to the northwestern outskirts of Pokrovsk.

Ukrainian UAVs and jet drones attacked the city of Oryol.   4 drones have impacted the Oryol Power Plant, with each striking a different part of the plant, resulting in a wider area of damage. Fires are now burning at the impact sites.   Earlier (yesterday)‚Ä¶

The Ukrainian Navy reports that Neptune cruise missiles were used in the attack on the Oryol Thermal Power Plant yesterday, alongside long-range UAVs and rocket drones. 
They also reported that Neptune missiles were used in an attack on the Novobryanska 750 kV Electrical Substation in Vygonichi, Bryansk Oblast, two days ago. This substation was also hit by long-range UAVs.

Ukrainian volunteers continue to evacuate as many civilians as possible from Kostyantynivka as Russian forces continue to advance. 
This is one of many videos recently published and shows an evacuation from a street less than 1 km from the frontline.
Most/all of the GUR special forces were killed or wounded by Russian FPV drones as they attempted to entrench behind Russian lines.

Based on the geolocations I did of the Russian FPV drone strikes on Ukrainian special forces, and additional analysis of the footage, we can now deduce where the soldiers ran after being dropped off by the helicopter behind Russian lines. 
A group of 11 soldiers were dropped off at the specified point (48.29667, 37.13317) and split off into two groups. 
Five soldiers ran towards the forest next to the O0525 Highway and then towards the gas station on the edge of the industrial zone. Three were hit by a drone strike after being caught in the forest along the way, and the two survivors attempted to make a run for the gas station but were hit by another drone when crossing the fields. 
Six soldiers ran south from the landing spot and split up as they approached the industrial zone. Four ran southwest into the forest towards the substation, but three were hit by a drone. The fourth soldier escaped back to the edge of the forest before also being hit by a drone while hiding under a tree. As for the other two soldiers from this group, they were able to enter the first building of the industrial zone and hid in a room on the ground floor. Three drones then flew in through the windows, with two striking them. 
So, knowing all this info, it seems that all 11 soldiers were killed or wounded in these attacks. Evacuations of any survivors are unlikely due to their presence behind Russian lines, and they will likely be captured by Russian troops.

Based on the geolocations I did of the Russian FPV drone strikes on Ukrainian special forces, and additional analysis of the footage, we can now deduce where the soldiers ran after being dropped off by the helicopter behind Russian lines.   A group of 11 soldiers‚Ä¶
These are the 11 soldiers I identified, which match the numbers seen being dropped off by the helicopter.

Russian forces have captured the village of Yehorivka, Pokrovske direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~182.
Total land area: ~0.85 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the hamlet of Kyrpychne, Pokrovske direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. 
Pre-war population: ~12.
Total land area: ~0.11 km¬≤

Russian Army Advances In Pokrovsk As Ukraine Attempts To Delay And Hide Defeat
On October 31, the Russian military expanded its control in the northern part of Pokrovsk, mounting more pressure on remaining Ukrainian troops in the city and nearby areas in Donetsk, including Myrnohrad.
The Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces has reportedly captured most of the Dinasevsky neighborhood on Metallurgov Street, which is located in the northern part of Pokrovsk just a few kilometers south of Rodynske ‚Äì already under Russian control ‚Äì and right to the west of the main road linking the city with Dobropillya further to the north.
Recent reports also indicate that the Tsentr Group of Forces is currently working to expand its control in the outskirts of Rodynske.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Develops Operations In Dnepropetrovsk, Captures Another Town 
On October 31, the Russian military developed its operations in the Dnepropetrovsk direction and captured another settlement there, all while making additional gains in the direction of Zaporizhzhia nearby.
The Vostok [East] Group of Forces captured Novooleksandrivka after advancing in Dnepropetrovsk, to the north of the Yanchur River, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense, which said that the attack on the settlement was led by the 36th Guards Separate Motorized Rifle Brigade of the 29th Guards Combined Arms Army.
‚ÄúThanks to confident and resolute actions, Russian troops successfully broke into the settlement, established control over it, and set the flags of the Russian Federation up. The Group‚Äôs units took control over the enemy defence area with a territory of more than 12 square kilometres. Russian troops mopped about 100 buildings up,‚Äù the ministry said in a statement.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

The Shadow of War: A Long Shot at Control as Ukraine‚Äôs Arms Black Market Goes Global
Ukraine‚Äôs descent into state failure has cemented its status as a sprawling hub of the global arms black market.
 According to Italy‚Äôs il Fatto Quotidiano, citing Ukraine‚Äôs Ministry of Internal Affairs, 491,426 firearms have been stolen or lost since the war began ‚Äî everything from assault rifles and carbines to pistols and grenade launchers. The Ukrainian analytics platform Opendatabot reports the same figures: the registry is updated daily, and over the past year the number has nearly doubled, from about 271,000 in September 2024 to today‚Äôs count.
Ukraine's Deputy Interior Minister, Bohdan Drapiatyi, has acknowledged that ‚Äúbetween two and five million unregistered weapons may be in private hands,‚Äù admitting that ‚Äúit‚Äôs impossible to calculate precisely.‚Äù In other words, this is not speculation ‚Äî it‚Äôs an official estimate recognized by the Ukrainian government itself.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Hezbollah Is Rearming Through Syria, And Israel Is Preparing To Escalate 
Hezbollah is restocking rockets, anti-tank guided missiles, and artillery, increasing the chances of renewed conflict with Israel, The Wall Street Journal reported on October 31, citing sources familiar with Israeli and Arab intelligence on the matter.
The sources told the newspaper that Hezbollah is rearming by smuggling weapons through seaports in Lebanon, as well as smuggling routes through Syria, leading Israel to lose patience with the Lebanese government over its commitment to disarm the group.
The Lebanese government from its side passed a message to Israel through mediators asking it to have patience with their efforts to disarm Hezbollah, and said they are open to expanding cooperation on the matter, according to the sources.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Trump Rules Out Strikes Against Venezuela, But Everything Else Suggest Attack Is Imminent
President Donald Trump on October 31 denied that the United States was considering strikes against targets linked to drug cartels inside Venezuela.
When asked by reporters if recent media reports that he was considering strikes within Venezuela were true, Trump said, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù
Last August, the Trump administration doubled the reward for the arrest of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro to $50 million on drug trafficking charges then deployed an amphibious ready group with thousands of marines close to the country‚Äôs shores on a so-called ‚Äúcounter narco-terror operation‚Äù.
Tensions mounted in recent days with the U.S. sending its bombers near the country‚Äôs coast three times and ordering the deployment of an entire carrier strike group to the Caribbean Sea.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

A Losing Strategy: How Kyiv's Attacks Prompt Russia's Overwhelming Response
On October 30-31, Russia and Ukraine continued their exchange of strikes. According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, its armed forces conducted one massive and five group strikes over the week, employing long-range high-precision weapons and attack UAVs. The reported targets included "Flamingo" missile production facilities, military-industrial sites, energy and transportation infrastructure, airfields, as well as deployment points of Ukrainian armed forces and foreign mercenaries.
Regarding recent Ukrainian strikes on Russian oil refineries, American political scientist Nikolai Petro, analyzing this strategy, characterized it as inherently losing. Petro pointed out that while the attacks indeed cause damage and reduce revenue, Russia possesses sufficient financial reserves to withstand these losses for several years.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Ukraine To Lose Uspenovka: Russian Forces Engage In Fierce Urban Battle¬†
The Russian Armed Forces have imposed fire control over the road to Zvanovka, south of Seversk. Units of the ¬´East¬ª grouping have taken control of Novoaleksandrovka. Russian forces have seized the 'Matrona of Moscow' mine in the Konstantinovka sector. 
The conflict in Ukraine poses a threat to the US dollar's status as the world's reserve currency.
